LanguageData.VinePenis.label: vines
LanguageData.VinePenis.description: Genetically altered vines capable of reproduction.
LanguageData.CactoidPenis.label: cactoid penis
LanguageData.CactoidPenis.description: A rough plant-like penis, with a barbed knot at the base, and a thin and flexible shaft. The head ressembles a large cactus flower bud.
LanguageData.CactoidVagina.label: cactoid vagina
LanguageData.CactoidVagina.description: A rough plant-like vagina, with soft thorns lining the inner walls. The thorns grip male genitals during sex.
LanguageData.CactoidBreasts.label: cactoid breasts
LanguageData.CactoidBreasts.description: A pair of rough plant-like breasts, with thorns all around it, and flower-like nipples.
LanguageData.CactoidAnus.label: cactoid anus
LanguageData.CactoidAnus.description: A rough plant-like anus. No thorns this time.
LanguageData.TreePenis.label: bark penis
LanguageData.TreePenis.description: A naturally grown wooden penis. The testicles are covered in a hard shell, while a wooden sheath protects the phalus. When erect, the large shaft extends, while the barbed head flares, somewhat ressembling a horse penis.
LanguageData.TreeVagina.label: bark vagina
LanguageData.TreeVagina.description: A naturally grown wooden vagina. While the outside looks like bark, the inside is soft.
LanguageData.TreeBreasts.label: bark breasts
LanguageData.TreeBreasts.description: A pair of naturally grown wooden breasts. Hard bark covers the entire outer portion, while leaving the nipples underneat exposed.
LanguageData.TreeAnus.label: bark anus
LanguageData.TreeAnus.description: A naturally grown wooden anus. While the outside looks like bark, the inside is soft.
LanguageData.AntherPenis.label: anther
LanguageData.AntherPenis.description: A flower's male reproductive organ. A long and thin filament forms the shaft, while a large pollen-producing head in the tip.
LanguageData.PistilVagina.label: pistil
LanguageData.PistilVagina.description: A flower's female reproductive organ. The sticky entrance is connected to the ovaries via a long tube-like structure.
